page.title: 14ST. BARTHOLOMEW'S BURWASH
page.content: The Church of St. Bartholomew's is built of stone, partly in the Early English style, but having a Norman tower, with a spire, containing a clock and six bells. The Church can seat 500 persons, it was enlarged and restored in 1856, the tower in 1890. The Register dates from the year 1558. There is a cast iron grave slab that is believed to date from the 14th century. The Church is on a bend in the High Street and if you walk through the churchyard you enter the school playground, just here there is a really lovely view across the valley towards the River Dudwell. I pass the church everyday on my way to school, I sing in the choir on Sundays and the choir practise on Friday evenings. I was christened here in the village church.
